intro: Pterophacos cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray pterophorus, is a small, delicate moth species belonging to the family Pterophoridae. It is characterized by its narrow wings that are typically covered in fine, ash-colored scales. The larvae of this species feed on various grasses and sedges, contributing to the ecological dynamics of its habitat. The adult moths are often active during the evening and are attracted to light sources. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Pterophacos cinerascens is considered a species of conservation concern in some regions.
